Review Content: Quezon is a somewhat tacky drama that reduces the life and career of former Philippines president Manuel L. Quezon to a series of trite political battles. All the characters have shallow personalities. The dialogue and acting are often cringeworthy.
Name: Carla Hay

Review Content: If Tarog’s goal was to make history feel alive again, then he has succeeded—sometimes to the point of discomfort. As cinema, “Quezon” is impressive. As history, it’s provocative. And as myth, it’s necessary.
Name: Paul Emmanuel Enicola
